data.title: Who Stole the Pixel?
data.statement:
A mysterious thief has stolen exactly one character from an image represented as a grid of alphabetic characters. Fortunately, you have two versions of the image:

Original image ([[H]] x [[W]] grid).

Corrupted image (same grid, but with one character missing — replaced with {{.}}).

The "corrupted" image may have been incorrectly identified. If no character is missing, output {{Nothing Stolen}}.

Your task is to find the character that was stolen, and the coordinates (row and column) of where it used to be.

The row and column use 0-based indexing

abcd
efgh

ef.h
ijkl

data.constraints:
`1 ≤ [[H]], [[W]] ≤ 10`

Original image does not contain any {{.}}
data.stubGenerator:
read h:int w:int
loop h read origRow:string(100)
loop h read corrRow:string(100)
write stolen_character row column
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated integers [[H]] and [[W]] for the height and width of the image.
<<Next [[H]] lines>>: The original image. Each line contains [[W]] characters.
<<Next [[H]] lines>>: The corrupted image. Each line contains [[W]] characters.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: The stolen character, the row, and the column where it used to be, separated by a space. Or {{Nothing Stolen}} if no character is missing.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A mysterious thief has stolen exactly one character from an image represented as a grid of alphabetic characters. Fortunately, you have two versions of the image:

Original image (H x W grid).

Corrupted image (same grid, but with one character missing — replaced with .).

The "corrupted" image may have been incorrectly identified. If no character is missing, output Nothing Stolen.

Your task is to find the character that was stolen, and the coordinates (row and column) of where it used to be.

The row and column use 0-based indexing
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers H and W for the height and width of the image.
Next H lines: The original image. Each line contains W characters.
Next H lines: The corrupted image. Each line contains W characters.
Output
Line 1: The stolen character, the row, and the column where it used to be, separated by a space. Or Nothing Stolen if no character is missing.
Constraints
1 ≤ H, W ≤ 10


Original image does not contain any .
Example
Input
1 1
X
.
Output
X 0 0
